bodyHtml:
NAD+ (Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide) for Advanced Research | >99% Purity

Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide (NAD+) is a vital coenzyme present in all living cells, fundamental for countless biological processes. While technically a dinucleotide and not a polypeptide chain, it is frequently associated with research peptides within the scientific community due to its critical role in regenerative biology studies and its common use alongside peptides from the same specialized suppliers. At Peptides Skin, we are committed to providing premium, research-grade NAD+ specifically formulated for high-precision in-vitro and laboratory experimentation.

Our NAD+ offering empowers researchers to delve into cellular metabolism, mitochondrial health, and sirtuin activation with a compound rigorously verified for exceptional stability and purity. This product is intended strictly for laboratory research use and is not approved for human or veterinary administration.

Understanding Research-Grade NAD+

NAD+ serves as a key substrate for numerous essential enzymes, including poly (ADP-ribose) polymerases (PARPs) and sirtuins (SIRT1–7). In the realm of biochemistry research, maintaining optimal levels of NAD+ is a focal point for studies on aging, oxidative stress resistance, and DNA repair mechanisms. We ensure our lyophilized NAD+ formulation provides maximum stability during transport and storage, offering researchers reliable baselines for their critical experiments.

Key Features for Scientific Research:

  • Exceptional Purity: Guaranteed >99% purity, meticulously verified through HPLC analysis to minimize experimental variables and ensure reliable results.
  • Optimized Stability: Provided as a lyophilized powder, designed to prevent degradation and ensure a long-term shelf life when stored correctly under recommended conditions.
  • Rigorous Quality Control: Each batch undergoes stringent quality control testing to confirm identity, concentration, and absence of contaminants.
  • Broad Research Utility: Ideal for a wide range of applications, including cell culture supplementation, enzyme kinetics studies, and comprehensive metabolic pathway analysis.

NAD+ Technical Specifications

Property Detail
Chemical Name Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide (Oxidized Form)
CAS Number 53-84-9
Molecular Formula C21H27N7O14P2
Molecular Weight 663.43 g/mol
Appearance White to off-white lyophilized powder
Solubility Soluble in water and aqueous buffers

Key Research Applications of NAD+

Researchers investigating the multifaceted roles of NAD+ focus on several primary biological mechanisms. It is crucial to note that these applications pertain strictly to controlled laboratory models (in-vitro or animal studies) and do not imply any human therapeutic use.

Mitochondrial Function & Bioenergetics

NAD+ is the principal electron carrier in oxidative phosphorylation. Studies aim to elucidate how exogenous NAD+ application in cell cultures influences ATP production and mitochondrial efficiency, particularly in contexts such as cellular senescence and metabolic stress.

Sirtuin Activation & Longevity Studies

Sirtuins, often referred to as "longevity genes," are a family of NAD+-dependent deacetylases. Current research explores how varying concentrations of NAD+ affect sirtuin activity, which in turn regulates critical cellular processes including cellular health, circadian rhythms, and inflammatory responses.

DNA Repair & Genomic Stability

Enzymes like PARPs (poly (ADP-ribose) polymerases) are crucial for repairing DNA strand breaks and maintaining genomic integrity, and they are highly dependent on NAD+. Research into advanced research peptide catalogs frequently includes NAD+ to investigate cellular resilience against genotoxic stress and radiation-induced damage.

Storage & Handling Guidelines

Proper storage and careful handling are paramount to maintain the integrity and potency of research chemicals like NAD+. NAD+ is sensitive to moisture and temperature fluctuations.

  • Storage: Store the lyophilized powder at -20°C. Ensure the vial is tightly sealed and protected from direct light to prevent degradation.
  • Reconstitution: Reconstitute with bacteriostatic water or a sterile buffer only immediately prior to use for optimal activity.
  • Stability: Once reconstituted, the solution should be used promptly or aliquoted and frozen at -20°C. Avoid repeated freeze-thaw cycles, which can compromise stability.

Why Choose Peptides Skin for Your Research Needs?

As a dedicated B2B supplier, Peptides Skin deeply understands the rigorous demands and precision required by the scientific community. We prioritize transparency, unparalleled quality, and exceptional service.

  • Verified Quality: Our NAD+ is rigorously third-party tested for purity and identity, providing confidence in your experimental outcomes.
  • Secure & Reliable Shipping: We utilize specialized packaging designed to maintain temperature stability during transit, ensuring product integrity upon arrival.
  • Expert Scientific Support: Our knowledgeable team is readily available to assist with technical inquiries and provide guidance regarding our comprehensive research chemical inventory.

Essential Safety & Research Disclaimer

WARNING: Research Use Only.

The product described (NAD+) is intended solely for laboratory research and development purposes. It is NOT approved for human consumption, injection, or cosmetic use. This product is not a drug, supplement, or food. Researchers must handle this compound in accordance with standard laboratory safety protocols, utilizing appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE). Any mention of biological effects refers exclusively to in-vitro or animal model research and should not be extrapolated to human applications.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) about NAD+

Is NAD+ actually a peptide?
Technically, no. NAD+ (Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide) is a coenzyme, composed of nucleotides rather than amino acids linked by peptide bonds. However, it is frequently grouped with NAD+ peptide products in the research industry because it is sold by the same specialized suppliers and utilized in similar longevity and metabolic research contexts.

What is the purity of your NAD+ for research?
Our NAD+ is strictly research-grade with a purity of >99%, verified by comprehensive HPLC analysis. This stringent quality standard ensures that your laboratory results are not compromised by impurities or fillers.

How should lyophilized NAD+ be stored?
Lyophilized NAD+ should be stored long-term at -20°C in a dry environment, protected from light. Once reconstituted into a liquid solution, it degrades rapidly; therefore, it should be used immediately or frozen in aliquots to preserve its potency.

Can this product be used for human injection or supplementation?
Absolutely not. This product is sold strictly for in-vitro and laboratory research use only. It is not manufactured, tested, or approved for human consumption, injection, or clinical therapy of any kind. Strict adherence to research-only guidelines is mandatory.

bodyHtml:
What Is Sermorelin (GRF 1-29) Peptide?

Sermorelin, also known as GRF 1-29, is a synthetic peptide fragment derived from Growth Hormone-Releasing Hormone (GHRH). It contains the first 29 amino acids responsible for activating pituitary GHRH receptors, which makes it widely studied in laboratory research focused on growth hormone signaling and endocrine regulation.

Sermorelin Peptide Structure and Research Role

The 29–amino acid sequence of sermorelin is designed to preserve full receptor activity while maintaining stability in controlled research environments. This precision makes it a reliable tool for studying hormone release mechanisms without introducing external growth hormone.

How Does Sermorelin Work?

In research settings, sermorelin functions as a selective GHRH agonist. It binds to GHRH receptors on somatotroph cells in the anterior pituitary, activating a cAMP-dependent signaling pathway associated with endogenous growth hormone production.

Sermorelin and Natural Growth Hormone Release

Unlike direct HGH compounds, sermorelin is studied for its ability to support natural, pulsatile growth hormone release. This characteristic makes it especially valuable for investigating endocrine feedback loops and physiological hormone rhythms.

Sermorelin Benefits in Scientific Research

Sermorelin is frequently referenced in research exploring growth hormone regulation, metabolic balance, and recovery-related pathways. Its mechanism allows researchers to observe how GHRH analogs influence long-term hormonal signaling rather than short-term hormone spikes.

Growth Hormone Pathways and Metabolic Research

Studies often examine sermorelin’s role in processes such as lipid metabolism, protein turnover, and cellular energy regulation, making it relevant in metabolic and endocrine-focused research models.

Sermorelin and Anti-Aging Research Focus

Growth hormone pathways are commonly associated with cellular renewal and recovery. For this reason, sermorelin appears in anti-aging research discussions where the focus is on gradual, regulated hormonal support rather than external hormone administration.

Sermorelin for Skin and Regeneration Studies

Research interest also includes the relationship between growth hormone signaling, skin regeneration, and tissue repair. Sermorelin allows researchers to study these effects through natural endocrine stimulation models.

Sermorelin Dosage and Research Handling

Sermorelin dosage in research varies depending on study design and peptide concentration. Accurate measurement and consistent protocols are essential when working with sensitive peptide compounds.

Responsible Use in Laboratory Settings

Sermorelin supplied by PeptidesSkin is intended strictly for in-vitro laboratory research. Proper handling, sterile techniques, and adherence to research protocols are critical for reliable results.

How Long Does Sermorelin Remain Stable?

Stability depends on storage conditions and handling. Lyophilized sermorelin is valued for its long shelf life, while reconstituted solutions require controlled refrigeration.

Storage Guidelines for Sermorelin Peptide

Lyophilized vials should be stored at -20°C for long-term stability. Once reconstituted, sermorelin should be kept at 4°C and typically used within 14–21 days. Avoid repeated freeze–thaw cycles to preserve peptide integrity.

Sermorelin vs HGH and Other Peptides

Sermorelin is often compared to HGH and other growth hormone–related peptides. While HGH introduces exogenous hormone, sermorelin supports endogenous release, making it useful for studying regulatory mechanisms and hormonal feedback systems.

Sermorelin vs Ipamorelin

Sermorelin acts through GHRH receptor activation, whereas ipamorelin is commonly studied as a growth hormone secretagogue with a different signaling pathway. This distinction helps researchers choose the most suitable compound for their objectives.

Purity, Quality, and Technical Specifications

Each sermorelin batch from PeptidesSkin is independently tested using HPLC and Mass Spectrometry to verify purity levels exceeding 99%. This ensures consistency, stability, and reliability for scientific research applications.

This unique peptide blend offers researchers an opportunity to investigate synergistic signaling mechanisms crucial for appetite regulation, gastric emptying, satiety, and overall metabolic homeostasis.

Mechanism of Action: Synergistic GLP-1 + Amylin Targeting

Semaglutide functions by mimicking endogenous GLP-1, thereby supporting insulin secretion, modulating appetite, and influencing glucose metabolism. Concurrently, Cagrilintide acts as an amylin receptor agonist, playing a critical role in regulating gastric emptying and significantly enhancing satiety signals.

Research models consistently indicate that the co-administration of these two agents can elicit a synergistic response, often surpassing the individual metabolic effects observed when either compound is used as a monotherapy. This dual agonism provides a more holistic approach to studying complex metabolic pathways.

CAGRISEMA is an invaluable tool for a wide array of advanced research applications:

  • Obesity & Metabolic Syndrome Research: Ideal for studying dual-pathway mechanisms involved in adipose tissue reduction and weight management.
  • Glycemic Regulation Models: Investigating the synergistic effects of GLP-1 and amylin on glucose homeostasis and insulin sensitivity.
  • Cardiometabolic Health Studies: Assessing metabolic markers and their response under combined GLP-1 and amylin agonism.
  • Comparative Peptide Research: Facilitates evaluation against other prominent metabolic peptides such as Semaglutide, Tirzepatide, and Retatrutide.

Storage & Handling Guidelines

To ensure the integrity and stability of CAGRISEMA for your research:

  • Handling Precautions: Always utilize sterile technique and appropriate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) during preparation and handling to prevent contamination and ensure safety.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Is CagriSema more effective than Semaglutide alone in research models?

Research models indicate that combining Cagrilintide with Semaglutide may produce greater effects on weight and metabolic signaling compared to GLP-1 agonism alone. The specific degree of effectiveness observed will depend on the pathways and experimental parameters under investigation.

How do Semaglutide and Cagrilintide differ in their mechanisms?

Semaglutide primarily targets and activates GLP-1 receptors, influencing insulin secretion and appetite. Cagrilintide acts as an agonist for amylin receptors, regulating gastric emptying and enhancing satiety. Together, they modulate appetite, satiety, and gastric emptying through distinct yet complementary biological pathways.

Introduction to Survodutide Peptide

Survodutide, also identified in scientific literature as BI 456906, is a cutting-edge dual GLP-1 and Glucagon receptor agonist currently under active investigation for its unique and potent metabolic effects. Unlike GLP-1–only analogs, which primarily focus on appetite suppression, Survodutide is specifically engineered to additionally promote energy expenditure through targeted glucagon activation.

At Peptides Skin, Survodutide is offered as a high-purity lyophilized powder, meticulously prepared for strict in vitro and controlled laboratory research settings.

Mechanism of Action: Dual GLP-1 / Glucagon Agonism

The profound scientific interest in Survodutide stems from its distinctive dual-target receptor profile, offering a comprehensive approach to metabolic regulation:

  • GLP-1 Receptor Activation: This pathway is well-known for its role in appetite regulation, slowing gastric emptying, and modulating glucoregulatory processes, contributing to improved metabolic control.
  • Glucagon Receptor Activation (GCGR): Crucially, glucagon activation increases resting metabolic rate and actively promotes lipolysis, facilitating the mobilization and utilization of fatty acids for energy.

This synergistic dual mechanism provides a powerful tool for metabolic research, simultaneously reducing caloric intake and significantly enhancing energy expenditure.

Key Research Applications of Survodutide

1. Metabolic Research & Energy Expenditure

Phase 2 clinical findings, reported by Boehringer Ingelheim and Zealand Pharma, indicate significant reductions in body weight and adiposity in various experimental models. Survodutide provides researchers with a unique opportunity to directly compare the efficacy and mechanisms of dual agonism versus mono-agonism in the complex pathways of weight regulation and energy balance.

2. MASH / Liver Health Studies

Survodutide is a focal point in studies investigating Metabolic Dysfunction-Associated Steatohepatitis (MASH). Evidence suggests that glucagon activation directly contributes to reducing hepatic fat accumulation, making this peptide invaluable for research into liver fibrosis, steatosis, and broader liver health.

Survodutide vs. Semaglutide vs. Retatrutide: A Comparative Overview

Peptide Receptor Targets Primary Research Focus
Survodutide GLP-1 + Glucagon Energy Expenditure, Obesity, MASH
Semaglutide GLP-1 Only Satiety, Glycemic Regulation
Retatrutide GLP-1 + GIP + Glucagon Triple Agonist – Maximal Metabolic Impact

Technical Specifications

  • Chemical Name: Survodutide (BI 456906)
  • Type: Dual GLP-1/Glucagon Analog
  • Purity: ≥ 99% (HPLC Verified)
  • Form: Sterile lyophilized powder
  • Solubility: Water, Saline, Bacteriostatic Water
  • Source: Synthetic peptide

Storage & Handling Guidelines

Proper storage is essential to maintain Survodutide’s integrity and purity:

  • Lyophilized Powder: Store at −20 °C or below for optimal stability (typically stable for up to 24 months).
  • Reconstituted Solution: Refrigerate at 4 °C and use within 2–3 weeks to ensure potency.
  • Avoid: Repeated freeze–thaw cycles, direct heat exposure, and high humidity, which can degrade the compound.

Safety & Research Disclaimer

For Laboratory Research Only — Not for Human Use.

  • This product is not intended for injection, therapeutic, or diagnostic use.
  • Always use appropriate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) when handling this compound.
  • Refer to the Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) for comprehensive safety guidance and handling protocols.

Why Choose Peptides Skin for Your Research?

  • B2B Reliability: Consistent stock availability and research-grade purity to support uninterrupted projects.
  • Temperature-Controlled Shipping: Specialized logistics maintain optimal temperatures, safeguarding molecular stability from our facility to your lab.

Frequently Asked Questions About Survodutide

What is the difference between Survodutide and Tirzepatide?

Survodutide targets GLP-1 and Glucagon receptors, with its primary research focus on enhancing energy expenditure. In contrast, Tirzepatide targets GLP-1 and GIP receptors, primarily emphasizing insulin sensitivity and appetite regulation.

What benefits are observed in Survodutide research?

Research models consistently show significant reductions in body weight, liver fat, and improvements in metabolic dysfunction. These benefits are primarily attributed to the combined effects of appetite suppression and glucagon-driven increases in energy expenditure.

Is Survodutide similar to Semaglutide?

No. Semaglutide is a GLP-1 mono-agonist, meaning it activates only the GLP-1 receptor. Survodutide, however, activates both GLP-1 and Glucagon receptors, providing a distinct dual metabolic effect that includes enhanced energy expenditure.

Can Survodutide be purchased for personal use?

No. Survodutide from Peptides Skin is strictly designated for laboratory research purposes and is not approved for personal consumption, medical treatment, or any clinical use.

bodyHtml:
Tesamorelin Peptide – High Purity Research Reagent

⚠ RESEARCH USE ONLY: Tesamorelin from Peptides Skin is intended exclusively for in vitro laboratory research and development. It is not a drug or finished pharmaceutical product and is not approved for human or veterinary use, injection, or consumption.

Introduction to Tesamorelin Peptide

Tesamorelin peptide is a synthetic analog of Growth Hormone-Releasing Hormone (GHRH), extensively studied for its potent ability to stimulate the synthesis and release of endogenous growth hormone (GH). Unlike native GHRH, tesamorelin incorporates an N-terminal trans-3-hexenoyl modification, which significantly enhances its stability and resistance to enzymatic degradation in biological systems.

At Peptides Skin, we supply premium-grade, lyophilized tesamorelin designated strictly as a research reagent. Each lot is manufactured to >99% purity and verified by High-Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC) and Mass Spectrometry (MS) to support reproducible scientific results.

Technical Specifications

Property Details
Chemical Name Tesamorelin Acetate
CAS Number 218949-48-5
Molecular Formula C221H366N72O67S
Molecular Weight 5135.9 g/mol (free base)
Purity ≥ 99.0% (HPLC)
Form Lyophilized white powder
Sequence Trans-3-hexenoyl-[Tyr1]hGRF(1–44)NH2

What Is Tesamorelin?

Tesamorelin is a 44-amino-acid peptide that functions as a growth hormone-releasing factor (GRF) analog. It closely mimics the full-length sequence of human GHRH with an added trans-3-hexenoyl group at the N-terminal tyrosine residue, a modification that improves its plasma stability and half-life in research models.

In clinical literature, tesamorelin has been investigated extensively, and proprietary drug products containing tesamorelin have received regulatory approval for specific indications. However, the material offered in our research peptide catalog is supplied only as a research reagent for in vitro and non-clinical in vivo studies and is not a finished pharmaceutical preparation.

At the mechanistic level, tesamorelin binds to GHRH receptors in the pituitary, promoting the pulsatile release of endogenous growth hormone and subsequent modulation of downstream mediators such as IGF-1. This makes it a valuable tool for exploring somatotropic axis physiology and metabolic regulation in controlled research settings.

Key Research Applications

Tesamorelin is frequently selected by researchers studying metabolic peptides and growth hormone pathways. Common preclinical and experimental applications include:

1. Visceral Adipose Tissue (VAT) and Body Composition Models

Research has highlighted tesamorelin as a probe for selectively targeting visceral adipose tissue (VAT) in experimental systems. VAT is metabolically active and strongly associated with insulin resistance and cardiometabolic risk. In such models, tesamorelin is used to examine how GHRH analogs may influence VAT mass, adipokine profiles, and overall body composition.

2. Growth Hormone Secretion Dynamics

Because tesamorelin stimulates endogenous GH release instead of providing exogenous recombinant HGH, it is widely used to study the somatotropic axis under more physiological conditions. Investigators monitor GH and IGF-1 responses, feedback regulation, and the preservation of circadian or diurnal secretion patterns.

3. Lipid Profiles and Metabolic Health

Scientific literature also explores how tesamorelin exposure may affect lipid parameters such as triglycerides and cholesterol in research models. These experiments support investigations into dyslipidemia, metabolic syndrome, and GH-related modulation of lipid metabolism.

Structure and Stability

The defining structural feature of tesamorelin is the trans-3-hexenoyl group attached to the N-terminal tyrosine of the hGRF(1–44) backbone. This modification increases resistance to degradation by dipeptidyl peptidase IV (DPP-IV) and other plasma enzymes, extending the peptide’s functional half-life compared with native GHRH derivatives such as sermorelin.

This enhanced stability, combined with high purity, makes tesamorelin a robust candidate for cell-based assays, receptor-binding experiments, and in vivo proof-of-concept studies where consistent exposure profiles are essential.

Storage and Handling

To preserve peptide integrity and performance, researchers should follow standard peptide handling practices:

  • Lyophilized Powder: Store at −20 °C or below, protected from light and moisture. Under these conditions, tesamorelin is typically stable for up to 24 months.
  • Reconstituted Solution: After reconstitution with bacteriostatic water or sterile saline, store at 4 °C and use within 1–2 weeks, depending on solvent and laboratory protocols.
  • Handling: Avoid repeated freeze–thaw cycles. Aliquot solutions where possible to minimize degradation.

Note: Tesamorelin is supplied as a lyophilized powder. Solvents for reconstitution are not included.

Why Choose Peptides Skin for Tesamorelin?

As a trusted B2B supplier, Peptides Skin focuses on delivering high-purity research peptides with full analytical transparency. We understand that reproducible data depend on consistent reagent quality.

  • High Purity: Every batch of tesamorelin is tested to confirm >99% purity by HPLC.
  • Documented Quality: Certificates of Analysis (CoA) and supporting analytical data are available to qualified research clients.
  • Secure Shipping: Packaging and logistics are optimized to maintain stability during transit.
  • Dedicated Support: Technical assistance is available for institutional and laboratory partners.

Safety & Research Disclaimer

⚠ WARNING: RESEARCH USE ONLY — NOT FOR HUMAN OR VETERINARY CONSUMPTION.
Products offered by Peptides Skin, including tesamorelin, are intended solely for laboratory research, in vitro testing, and chemical analysis. They are not approved as drugs, foods, cosmetics, or dietary supplements. Nothing in this description is intended as medical or therapeutic advice.

Frequently Asked Questions about Tesamorelin

Is Tesamorelin the same as natural GHRH?

Tesamorelin is an analog of human GHRH, meaning it closely resembles the endogenous peptide but includes additional structural modifications—notably an N-terminal trans-3-hexenoyl group—to enhance stability and half-life in research models.

What is the primary research use of Tesamorelin?

Tesamorelin is primarily used to study growth hormone secretion dynamics, visceral adipose tissue models, and metabolic regulation. It allows researchers to stimulate endogenous GH release and monitor downstream effects on IGF-1, lipid profiles, and body composition in controlled experimental systems.

How should Tesamorelin peptide be stored?

Lyophilized tesamorelin should be stored at −20 °C or below, protected from light and moisture. After reconstitution in an appropriate solvent, it is generally kept at 4 °C and used within 1–2 weeks, avoiding repeated freeze–thaw cycles.

Is Tesamorelin from Peptides Skin suitable for human therapy?

No. Tesamorelin supplied by Peptides Skin is labeled strictly for research use only. It is not a pharmaceutical product and is not intended or approved for human or veterinary therapy, self-administration, or diagnostic applications.

Introduction to PT-141 Peptide (Bremelanotide)

PT-141 peptide, also known scientifically as Bremelanotide, is a synthetic peptide analogue of alpha-melanocyte-stimulating hormone (α-MSH). Unlike traditional agents that primarily act on the vascular system, PT-141 is extensively studied for its potential influence on the central nervous system (CNS) through the activation of specific melanocortin receptors.

As a leading offering from Peptides Skin, our PT-141 is synthesized to exceed 99% purity, helping ensure consistent and reliable data for rigorous laboratory experiments. It is commonly utilized in studies focusing on sexual function pathways, hemorrhagic shock models, and the broader physiology of the melanocortin system.

Key Features of Our Research-Grade PT-141

  • High Purity (>99%): Verified via HPLC and Mass Spectrometry analysis for identity and purity, crucial for accurate research outcomes.
  • Lyophilized Stability: Supplied as a freeze-dried powder to maximize shelf life and maintain structural integrity during transport and storage.
  • Research Grade: Manufactured specifically for academic, biotech, and pharmaceutical R&D sectors, meeting stringent quality standards.
  • Batch Consistency: Rigorous quality control ensures uniform peptide content and performance across all production lots, supporting reproducible research.

Technical Specifications of Bremelanotide (PT-141)

Property Details
Chemical Name Bremelanotide (PT-141)
Sequence Ac-Nle-cyclo[Asp-His-D-Phe-Arg-Trp-Lys]-OH (cyclic 2–7 heptapeptide)

Molecular Weight 1025.2 g/mol
CAS Number 189691-06-3
Appearance White to off-white lyophilized powder

Research Applications & Mechanism of Action of PT-141

PT-141 is a cyclic heptapeptide lactam analogue of α-MSH. Its primary utility in the research community stems from its distinct interaction with the melanocortin system, which differentiates it from agents that rely predominantly on vascular mechanisms.

Melanocortin Receptor Interaction (MC3R/MC4R Agonism)

Experimental data indicate that PT-141 acts as an agonist at specific melanocortin receptors, particularly MC3R and MC4R. These receptors are expressed in key regions of the central nervous system. By activating these pathways, PT-141 is employed in studies to investigate neural modulation of metabolism, inflammatory signaling, and sexual behavior in various animal models.

Studies on CNS-Driven Libido Pathways

Research frequently compares PT-141 to phosphodiesterase-5 (PDE5) inhibitors. While PDE5 inhibitors primarily influence vascular blood flow, PT-141 is studied for its ability to engage hypothalamic circuits and melanocortin signaling. This provides a valuable model for exploring arousal pathways that are neurological rather than solely vascular in origin. Consequently, PT-141 serves as a crucial reference compound for investigating conditions such as hypoactive sexual desire disorder (HSDD) in pre-clinical settings.

Storage & Handling Guidelines for PT-141

To maintain the integrity and efficacy of the peptide structure, proper storage and handling are paramount.

  • Lyophilized Powder: Store at −20 °C. Under recommended conditions, PT-141 is typically stable for up to 3 years.
  • Reconstituted Solution: Once mixed with a suitable solvent (e.g., bacteriostatic water), store at 4 °C and use within 2–3 weeks to minimize degradation. Avoid repeated freeze–thaw cycles.

bodyHtml:
Tesamorelin is a synthetic growth hormone-releasing hormone (GHRH) analog comprised of 44 amino acids. Widely recognized in the scientific community for its potential to stimulate the synthesis and release of endogenous growth hormone, this peptide is a critical tool for researchers investigating metabolic disorders, visceral adipose tissue reduction, and pituitary function.

At Peptides Skin, we provide high-purity (≥99%) Tesamorelin exclusively for in-vitro and laboratory experimentation. Our catalog is designed for qualified professionals seeking a reliable B2B supplier of stable, lyophilized research peptides.

⚠️ RESEARCH USE ONLY: This product is strictly for laboratory research and development. It is NOT for human consumption, veterinary use, or therapeutic application. Bodily introduction of any kind is strictly prohibited.

Product Overview: High-Purity Tesamorelin

Tesamorelin (trans-3-hexenoyl-GHRH) is chemically distinct due to the addition of a trans-3-hexenoic acid group at the N-terminus. This structural modification improves the peptide's stability and half-life compared to native GHRH, allowing for more sustained receptor interaction in research subjects. It is most frequently cited in studies involving HIV-associated lipodystrophy and visceral fat accumulation.

As a leading research peptide catalog provider, we ensure every vial undergoes rigorous HPLC and Mass Spectrometry analysis to verify purity and sequence identity.

Technical Specifications & Chemical Data

Chemical Name Tesamorelin (acetate)
CAS Number 218949-48-5
Molecular Formula C221H366N72O67S
Molecular Weight 5135.9 g/mol
Purity ≥ 99.0% (HPLC)
Appearance White Lyophilized Powder
Sequence Trans-3-hexenoyl-Tyr-Ala-Asp-Ala-Ile-Phe-Thr-Asn-Ser-Tyr-Arg-Lys-Val-Leu-Gly-Gln-Leu-Ser-Ala-Arg-Lys-Leu-Leu-Gln-Asp-Ile-Met-Ser-Arg-Gln-Gln-Gly-Glu-Ser-Asn-Qln-Glu-Arg-Gly-Ala-Arg-Ala-Arg-Leu-NH2

Mechanism of Action: GHRH Analog

In research settings, Tesamorelin functions by binding to growth hormone-releasing hormone receptors (GHRHr) located in the anterior pituitary gland. This binding action mimics endogenous GHRH, triggering the pulsatile release of growth hormone (GH). Unlike non-specific secretagogues, Tesamorelin preserves the natural feedback loop involving Somatostatin and IGF-1 (Insulin-like Growth Factor 1).

Research indicates that this mechanism allows for an elevation in basal GH and IGF-1 levels without significantly altering glucose parameters in most non-diabetic models, making it a subject of interest for metabolic stability studies.

Primary Research Applications

Visceral Adipose Tissue (VAT) Studies

The most prominent area of research for Tesamorelin involves the reduction of visceral adipose tissue. Clinical literature (referencing FDA-approved uses in humans, which differs from our RUO context) suggests that Tesamorelin specifically targets VAT rather than subcutaneous fat. Laboratory models use this peptide to investigate pathways of lipolysis and triglyceride reduction in the abdominal cavity.

Metabolic Function & Lipodystrophy Models

Tesamorelin is extensively used in creating and treating models of lipodystrophy—a disorder characterizing abnormal fat distribution. Researchers utilize this peptide to study how GHRH analogs can modulate lipid profiles, including cholesterol and triglycerides, in subjects with compromised metabolic function.

Growth Hormone Secretion Pathways

Beyond fat metabolism, this peptide is utilized to map the pharmacokinetics of the pituitary gland. It serves as a control or variable in studies comparing the efficacy of various GHRH analogs versus Ghrelin mimetics (like Ipamorelin or GHRP-6).

Storage, Handling, and Stability

Proper handling is essential to maintain the integrity of the peptide structure.

  • Lyophilized State: Store at -20°C. Stable for up to 24 months.
  • Reconstituted: Once mixed with bacteriostatic water or sterile saline (for lab analysis), the solution should be kept at 4°C and used within 14–21 days. Avoid repeated freeze-thaw cycles.
  • Light Sensitivity: Protect from direct light during storage.

Safety & Compliance

Peptides Skin adheres to strict regulatory guidelines. Tesamorelin is sold as a chemical reference material.

  • Not for Human Use: This product is not a drug, food, or cosmetic. It is not approved by the FDA for treatment in humans when sold as a research chemical.
  • Experimental Risks: Researchers should be equipped with proper PPE (gloves, goggles, lab coats) when handling lyophilized peptides.
  • Ingestion Warning: Accidental ingestion or injection can cause adverse physiological reactions. Seek medical attention immediately in case of exposure.

Melanotan 2 is widely studied as an agonist of the MC1 receptor (MC1R). Research focuses on how MC1R activation influences the synthesis of eumelanin and downstream signaling cascades in melanocytes.

Behavioral & Metabolic Studies

Beyond pigmentation, MT-2 is commonly employed in studies involving MC3 and MC4 receptors in the central nervous system. Pre-clinical literature suggests these receptors may contribute to the regulation of energy balance and certain behavioral responses in animal models. What is the difference between Melanotan 1 and Melanotan 2 peptide?

bodyHtml:
⚠ RESEARCH USE ONLY: This product is strictly for laboratory research and development purposes. It is not approved for human consumption, injection, or cosmetic use.

GHK-Cu Peptide (Copper Tripeptide-1) | 99%+ Purity Research Grade

Introduction to GHK-Cu Peptide

GHK-Cu peptide, also known as Copper Tripeptide-1, is a naturally occurring copper complex initially identified in human plasma. This tripeptide, comprising glycyl-L-histidyl-L-lysine (GHK) bound to copper(II), exhibits a high affinity for Cu2+ ions. It is extensively utilized in research focusing on tissue remodeling, regenerative biology, and skin physiology.

At Peptides Skin, we supply premium-grade, lyophilized GHK-Cu specifically manufactured for in vitro and laboratory investigations. Our commitment emphasizes batch-to-batch consistency and analytical transparency.

Product Overview & Specifications

Product Name GHK-Cu (Copper Tripeptide-1)
Sequence Gly-His-Lys (GHK) copper(II) complex
CAS Number 49557-75-7
Molecular Formula C14H24N6O4Cu
Purity ≥ 99.0% (HPLC verified)
Form Lyophilized blue powder
Solubility Soluble in water, saline, and common laboratory buffers

What Is GHK-Cu Peptide?

GHK-Cu is a small peptide-copper complex found naturally in human plasma, saliva, and urine. Dr. Loren Pickart first characterized it in the 1970s as a growth-modulating factor linked to tissue repair. In biological systems, endogenous GHK-Cu levels typically decrease with age, a trend correlated with reduced regenerative capacity in various experimental models.

In laboratory research, GHK-Cu is frequently employed to investigate how copper-peptide complexes may influence gene expression patterns related to tissue repair, oxidative stress defense, and extracellular matrix remodeling. It is often described as a potential “injury signal” peptide, participating in the early phases of the repair cascade.

Key Research Applications

Scientific literature highlights multiple lines of investigation involving GHK-Cu. The following applications refer to pre-clinical and in vitro findings and are not claims of therapeutic efficacy in humans.

1. Collagen and Glycosaminoglycan Synthesis

In dermal fibroblast cultures, GHK-Cu has been reported to support the synthesis of collagen (including types I, III, and IV), elastin, and glycosaminoglycans. These matrix components are crucial for skin structure and mechanical resilience, making GHK-Cu a widely used tool in extracellular matrix and skin biology research.

2. Wound Healing & Tissue Remodeling

Pre-clinical animal models suggest that GHK-Cu may influence wound repair by modulating antioxidant enzyme levels and inflammatory mediators such as TNF-α and IL-6. It has also been investigated for potential roles in angiogenesis and the regulation of matrix metalloproteinases (MMPs) and their inhibitors, both central to tissue remodeling dynamics.

3. Hair Follicle & Skin Research

In vitro and in vivo studies have explored the impact of GHK-Cu on hair follicle biology, including follicle size and hair shaft density. Some experimental work has examined whether GHK-Cu can counteract signaling pathways associated with follicle miniaturization, though such findings remain in the research domain and do not imply clinical approval or cosmetic claims.

Storage and Handling Guidelines

Correct storage is essential to preserve the integrity and activity of the peptide complex.

  • Lyophilized Powder: Store at −20 °C, dry and protected from light. Under these conditions, GHK-Cu is typically stable for 24+ months.
  • Reconstituted Solution: After dissolution in bacteriostatic water or suitable buffer, store at 4 °C and use within 2–3 weeks.
  • Handling: Avoid repeated freeze–thaw cycles and limit exposure to heat, air, and direct light during experimental use.

Why Choose Peptides Skin?

Peptides Skin is a specialized B2B supplier focused on high-purity research peptides and reference standards. When you select our GHK-Cu, you benefit from:

  • Third-Party Testing: Each batch is verified via HPLC and Mass Spectrometry (MS) for identity and purity.
  • Strict Quality Protocols: Processes are designed to minimize contaminants and enhance stability.
  • B2B-Oriented Logistics: Secure, temperature-conscious shipping options and support for bulk and wholesale orders.

Safety & Research Disclaimer

WARNING: This product is a laboratory research chemical. It is not a drug, food, cosmetic, or dietary ingredient and must not be ingested, injected, or applied to human or animal skin.

Use is restricted to qualified professionals working within properly equipped laboratories. All handling should be conducted with appropriate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and in accordance with institutional and regulatory safety guidelines.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

What is the primary mechanism of GHK-Cu in research?

In research settings, GHK-Cu is primarily studied for its ability to complex with copper ions and influence gene expression related to tissue repair, inflammatory response, and antioxidant defense pathways. It has also been associated with the modulation of metalloproteinases and their inhibitors in extracellular matrix studies.

How should GHK-Cu peptide be stored?

Lyophilized GHK-Cu should be stored at −20 °C, away from light and moisture, where it can remain stable for up to 24 months. Once reconstituted in a suitable solvent, it should be refrigerated at 4 °C and used within a few weeks for optimal stability.

Is GHK-Cu peptide legal to purchase for research?

In most jurisdictions, GHK-Cu may be purchased legally for laboratory and research use, as it is generally not classified as a controlled substance. However, it is not approved by regulatory agencies such as the FDA for human therapeutic use or consumption, and buyers are responsible for ensuring local compliance.

Does GHK-Cu support hair growth in scientific studies?

Pre-clinical research has reported that GHK-Cu can stimulate hair follicle activity and increase follicle size in certain experimental models. These observations are limited to in vitro and animal studies and should not be interpreted as clinical or cosmetic claims.

Is this product suitable for cosmetic or personal use?

No. While GHK-Cu appears as an ingredient in some finished cosmetic formulations, the raw GHK-Cu supplied by Peptides Skin is labeled strictly for research use. It is not intended for direct cosmetic formulation or any form of personal application by end-users.

bodyHtml:
Ipamorelin Peptide (Research Grade) – >99% Purity

Introduction to Ipamorelin Peptide

Ipamorelin peptide is a synthetic pentapeptide and a highly selective agonist of the ghrelin/growth hormone secretagogue receptor (GHS-R1a). It is extensively utilized in laboratory studies focusing on growth hormone (GH) pulsatility, metabolic regulation, and recovery-related pathways. Distinct from several other Growth Hormone Releasing Peptides (GHRPs), pre-clinical literature reports that Ipamorelin stimulates GH release with minimal impact on cortisol or prolactin levels.

At Peptides Skin, we provide premium, lyophilized Ipamorelin intended strictly for in vitro and controlled laboratory research purposes.

⚠ Research Use Only: This product is not approved for human or veterinary consumption, diagnostic, or therapeutic use.

Technical Specifications of Ipamorelin

Our Ipamorelin peptide is manufactured under stringent quality controls and analyzed using HPLC and Mass Spectrometry to support reproducible and reliable research outcomes.

Parameter Specification
Chemical Name Ipamorelin Acetate
Sequence Aib-His-D-2-Nal-D-Phe-Lys-NH2
CAS Number 170851-70-4
Molecular Formula C38H49N9O5
Molecular Weight 711.85 g/mol
Purity ≥ 99% (HPLC verified)
Appearance White lyophilized powder
Solubility Soluble in water, sterile saline, or bacteriostatic water

Mechanism of Action: Selective GHS-R1a Agonist

Ipamorelin functions as a mimetic of ghrelin, often referred to as the “hunger hormone.” It binds selectively to the Growth Hormone Secretagogue Receptor (GHS-R1a) expressed in the pituitary gland, where it triggers intracellular signaling cascades that promote the release of stored growth hormone.

Ghrelin Receptor Interaction

By mimicking the active domain of ghrelin, Ipamorelin binds to receptors on somatotroph cells and induces a pulse of GH secretion that closely resembles the body’s endogenous pulsatile rhythm. Its high receptor selectivity helps limit off-target activity in research models.

Comparison with GHRP-2 and GHRP-6

Classical GHRPs, such as GHRP-2 and GHRP-6, are potent GH secretagogues but are often associated with co-secretion of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), cortisol, and prolactin. Ipamorelin differentiates itself through its greater selectivity; it promotes GH release in pre-clinical models while demonstrating a lower tendency to elevate cortisol or prolactin and generally exhibits less orexigenic (appetite-stimulating) activity than GHRP-6.

Research Applications & Potential of Ipamorelin

Ipamorelin is a versatile tool compound in our research peptide catalog, used across multiple experimental frameworks. Current research commonly focuses on the areas below:

Growth Hormone Secretion Studies

Researchers employ Ipamorelin to investigate GH deficiency models and to map the dynamics of the hypothalamic–pituitary axis. It is frequently used to study how selective GHS-R1a stimulation influences plasma GH profiles over time.

Metabolic & Body Composition Research

Pre-clinical studies have assessed Ipamorelin in the context of nitrogen balance, lipolysis (fat breakdown), and muscle protein turnover. These investigations aim to clarify how GH secretagogues may affect catabolic and anabolic states in research subjects.

Synergistic Studies with CJC-1295

Another active line of research examines the combination of Ipamorelin with CJC-1295, a Growth Hormone Releasing Hormone (GHRH) analog. Because Ipamorelin acts at the pituitary and CJC-1295 at the hypothalamic level, researchers use this pairing to explore potential synergistic effects on GH pulsatility in experimental models. These combinations remain confined to controlled laboratory investigations.

Storage, Stability & Handling of Ipamorelin

Proper handling is critical to preserving peptide integrity throughout your research workflow.

  • Lyophilized (Powder): Store at −20 °C. Stable for up to 24 months under recommended conditions.
  • Reconstituted (Solution): After reconstitution (e.g., with bacteriostatic water), store at 4 °C and use within 2–4 weeks.
  • Handling: Avoid repeated freeze–thaw cycles and minimize exposure to heat, air, and direct light.

Why Choose Peptides Skin as Your B2B Supplier?

As a dedicated B2B supplier, Peptides Skin is focused on providing research institutions with dependable peptide materials.

  • Verified Purity: Each batch is tested to confirm >99% purity, reducing unwanted experimental variability.
  • Analytical Transparency: HPLC and MS data are available via COA to verify identity and quality.
  • Secure Shipping: Packaging is optimized to maintain peptide stability during transport.
  • Reliable Inventory: Consistent stock and bulk options to support ongoing research programs.

Safety, Research Context & Disclaimers for Ipamorelin

Warning: Research Use Only — Not for Human Consumption.

The Ipamorelin peptide supplied by Peptides Skin is a chemical reference standard intended solely for laboratory research and development. It is not a food, or cosmetic and is not approved by the FDA or any regulatory authority for use in humans or animals.

Published pre-clinical literature has noted occasional observations such as mild headache or injection-site reactions in animal models. These findings are specific to controlled research settings and do not constitute medical advice. All handling should be performed using appropriate PPE and in accordance with institutional biosafety guidelines.

Frequently Asked Questions About Ipamorelin

What is the primary function of Ipamorelin in research?

In research settings, Ipamorelin is used to stimulate the release of growth hormone from the pituitary gland via selective activation of GHS-R1a. This allows scientists to study GH secretion dynamics with reduced influence on cortisol and prolactin compared to some other GHRPs.

How does Ipamorelin differ from CJC-1295?

Ipamorelin is a ghrelin mimetic (growth hormone secretagogue) that acts directly at the pituitary to trigger GH release. CJC-1295 is a GHRH analog that amplifies the hypothalamic signal upstream. In research, they are often studied together to explore potential synergistic effects on GH pulsatility through complementary mechanisms.

What is the shelf life of lyophilized Ipamorelin?

When stored correctly at −20 °C in its lyophilized form, Ipamorelin is generally stable for up to 24 months. After reconstitution, it should be kept at 4 °C and used within a few weeks for best stability.

Does Ipamorelin affect testosterone levels?

Ipamorelin is considered highly selective for the GH secretagogue receptor and does not directly target androgen receptors or the hypothalamic–pituitary–gonadal axis in research models. Accordingly, it is not typically studied as a direct modulator of testosterone.

Is this product suitable for human use?

No. The Ipamorelin supplied by Peptides Skin is designated strictly for in vitro and laboratory research use only. It must not be used for human administration, self-experimentation, or therapeutic purposes.

AOD 9604 is also evaluated in studies involving cartilage structure and connective tissue biology. Pre-clinical models have explored its potential relevance in hyaline cartilage integrity and joint-related research, making it valuable in the fields of regenerative medicine and tissue engineering.

They are closely related but not identical. AOD 9604 is a modified derivative of the hGH C-terminal fragment (176/177–191), engineered for enhanced stability and improved resistance to enzymatic breakdown.

Key Research Applications of Cagrilintide

1. CNS Signaling, Satiety Pathways, and Energy Homeostasis

Cagrilintide is widely used to investigate central nervous system pathways involved in satiety and energy balance. By targeting amylin and calcitonin receptor complexes in regions such as the area postrema and nucleus tractus solitarius, it enables detailed mapping of downstream signaling cascades that modulate feeding behavior and energy homeostasis in preclinical models.

2. Synergistic Studies with GLP-1 Receptor Agonists

Researchers frequently co-administer Cagrilintide with GLP-1 receptor agonists (e.g., Semaglutide) to explore dual-hormone signaling and its impact on metabolic regulation in experimental settings. This combination helps clarify how complementary pathways may influence energy expenditure, adiposity, and broader metabolic endpoints in non-clinical studies.

3. Gastric Emptying and Glucose Kinetics Research

As an amylin analogue, Cagrilintide is a valuable tool in in-vitro and in-vivo preclinical assays focused on gastric emptying, post-prandial hormone responses, and glucose absorption dynamics. Its prolonged activity supports longitudinal protocols designed to quantify the kinetics of glucose handling and glucagon modulation in controlled research environments.

bodyHtml:
Semaglutide (SEMA) is a high-purity, synthetic glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) receptor agonist, supplied for laboratory and research purposes. As an analog of human GLP-1, it is a primary compound for in-vitro studies related to glycemic control, appetite regulation, and metabolic pathways.

At Peptides Skin, we provide lyophilized Semaglutide with a verified purity of ≥99%, ensuring your experimental results are based on a reliable and consistent compound. This product is intended strictly for scientific investigation.

Semaglutide for Research: An Overview

Semaglutide is a modified peptide engineered for enhanced stability and a longer half-life compared to native GLP-1. This makes it an invaluable tool for researchers needing to observe sustained GLP-1 receptor activation in controlled laboratory models.

Is Semaglutide a Peptide?

Yes, Semaglutide is a synthetic peptide composed of a chain of amino acids. Its structure is based on the endogenous hormone GLP-1, with specific modifications to resist enzymatic degradation, making it ideal for research applications requiring long-acting effects.

Semaglutide vs. Tirzepatide: Key Differences for Researchers

A frequent question is how Semaglutide compares to Tirzepatide. While both are used in metabolic research, they function differently:

  • Semaglutide: A single-agonist that targets the GLP-1 receptor. Its research focus is primarily on glycemic control and appetite suppression pathways.
  • Tirzepatide: A dual-agonist that targets both the GLP-1 and GIP receptors. It is studied for its potential synergistic effects on metabolism and weight management models.

Choosing between them depends entirely on the specific receptor pathways your research aims to investigate.

Mechanism of Action & Primary Areas of Study

Semaglutide in Weight Loss Research Models

One of the most significant areas of study is the use of Semaglutide in weight loss models. Research focuses on its effects on the central nervous system to suppress appetite and its ability to delay gastric emptying. These studies help scientists understand the complex hormonal regulation of energy balance.

Glycemic Control Pathways

Semaglutide is a standard compound for investigating insulin secretion from pancreatic beta-cells and the suppression of glucagon. Its glucose-dependent mechanism of action makes it a key tool for creating and studying models of metabolic disorders.

Research-Grade vs. Compounded Semaglutide

It is critical for researchers to understand the distinction. "Compounded Semaglutide" is prepared by pharmacies, often for specific applications, and may contain different salt forms or excipients. In contrast, the research-grade Semaglutide from Peptides Skin is a pure, raw material (>99% purity) with a verifiable Certificate of Analysis. It provides a clean, consistent baseline for reproducible scientific experiments.

Storage Store at -20°C (Lyophilized)
